subject: Re: [junit] Running tests in a logical flow..
msgSnippet: Thanks guyz for the direction.. Paul, I like your example Peel- Cut- Eat....exactly they themselves are tests and also are dependent.. I found this URL also
messageBody:
Thanks guyz for the direction..

Paul, I like your example Peel-> Cut->Eat....exactly they themselves
are tests and also are dependent..
I found this URL also useful. I will update whether TestNG solves my problem

http://beust.com/weblog/archives/000171.html

Someone blogged saying this is not a good OO approach. Not sure I
understand what that means. Simple equation: you have some CRUD
operations and every other operations are dependent on these so all
your other tests need to dependent the CRUD tests right. Is this not
pure OO?

~JAK

On Thu, 31 Mar 2005 13:22:23 +1000, Paul King <paulk@...> wrote:
>
> You might want to consider TestNG. It supports
> dependent tests as well as isolated ones.
> For a discussion on why dependent tests are
> sometimes useful, see here:
>
> http://beust.com/weblog/archives/000259.html
>
> Summary, it lets you indicate dependencies
> and create test sequences (quoting the example):
>
> "testPeel()
> testChop()
> testEat()
> ...
> I'd like testChop() to run only if testPeel() succeeds, not have two
> failures."
>
> Cheers, Paul.
>
> Chris Dollin wrote:
> > On Wednesday 30 March 2005 06:42, Arun J wrote:
> >
> >>Folks,
> >>
> >>I am trying to do the following two things..
> >>
> >>#1. I have multiple related tests and I am trying to execute them in a
> >>logical flow. say
> >>Test1.run();
> >>if(Test1_result.wasSuccessful()){
> >> Test2.run();
> >> if(Test2_result.wasSuccessful()){
> >> Test3.run();
> >> Test4.run();
> >> if(Test4_result.wasSuccessful()){
> >> Test5.run();
> >> }
> >> }
> >>}
> >
> >
> > This kind of test dependency is usually seen as a Bad Thing.
> > Why do you want to do it? Can you be more specific about the
> > dependency?
> >
> > (I don't think we've ever needed that kind of dependency in
> > the Jena test suite. The only real extra we have is that some
> > of the database tests - I think only the BEB JE tests, but
> > maybe some of the RDB tests to - have a wrapper that ensures
> > that the databases are clean before testing. EG the JE tests
> > wipe all the JE log files out of the target directory before
> > running the tests.)
> >
>
